intro: Galium baicalense, commonly known as Siberian bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white to pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Galium baicalense thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
